title: Landing on Rocky Shore Through Waves
brief: Safe technique for reaching shore when only rocky coastline is available.
steps: Step 1: Look for areas where waves rush up onto rocks, avoid places where waves explode with high white spray.
Step 2: Stay fully clothed and keep shoes on to reduce injury from rocks.
Step 3: Swim slowly on approach to conserve strength for holding onto rocks.
Step 4: Advance behind a large wave into the breakers.
Step 5: Face toward shore and take sitting position with feet in front, 60-90 centimeters (2-3 feet) lower than your head.
Step 6: Let your feet absorb shock when you strike submerged rocks or reefs.
Step 7: If you don't reach shore behind first wave, swim with hands only until next wave approaches.
Step 8: Repeat sitting position with feet forward for each wave until you land.
warnings: Rocky shores can cause severe injuries - proper body position is critical for safety.
Never approach areas where waves create high white spray - indicates dangerous rock formations.
Keep feet positioned to absorb impact - landing head-first can cause fatal injuries.
source: FM21-76_SurvivalManual.pdf â€” US Army Survival Manual
